variants.Description in input context: Deletion of the C terminus leads to loss of membrane association and misfolding/aggregation. Four N-terminal missense mutations in the UBL domain decrease stability, causing proteasomal degradation.

Material used.Description: Assessment of parkin mutant expression and degradation in cell culture models.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Loss of membrane association, misfolding, aggregation; proteasomal degradation
Readout description.Result Description: C-terminal deletion variants show reduced membrane localization and increased aggregation; N-terminal mutations exhibit accelerated proteasomal degradation.

Biological replicates.Description: Replicates were performed in multiple cell lines to validate findings.

Technical replicates.Description: Protein samples were repeated in triplicate for consistency.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type parkin protein was used as a control for Western blot analysis.

Basic negative control.Description: Lysate from untransfected cells was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to compare protein expression levels between mutant and wild-type samples.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression greater than 70% of wild-type levels in Western blot.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression less than 30% of wild-type levels in Western blot.
